hedline.hl1: Navy Selects Agency For Recruiting Effort

abstract.p: US Navy names Campbell-Ewald to handle advertising to support efforts to recruit and retain personnel; billings put at $40 million to $50 million in next year (S)

block.p: The United States Navy has named Campbell-Ewald in Warren, Mich., part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, to handle advertising to support efforts to recruit and retain personnel. The Navy plans to spend $40 million to $50 million in the next year.

The contract, which offers Campbell-Ewald incentives based on the Navy's achieving recruitment and retention goals, initially runs for two months, with five one-year renewal options. The Navy estimates the maximum value over the course of the contract at $330 million.

The United States Navy has named Campbell-Ewald in Warren, Mich., part of the Interpublic Group of Companies, to handle advertising to support efforts to recruit and retain personnel. The Navy plans to spend $40 million to $50 million in the next year.

The contract, which offers Campbell-Ewald incentives based on the Navy's achieving recruitment and retention goals, initially runs for two months, with five one-year renewal options. The Navy estimates the maximum value over the course of the contract at $330 million.

The New York office of BBDO Worldwide, which had handled most of the account, did not take part in a mandated review. The review, which lasted six months, had been narrowed to Campbell-Ewald and four other finalists: Bates USA in New York, part of the Bates Worldwide unit of the Cordiant Communications Group; Hill & Knowlton in Washington, part of the WPP Group, in cooperation with a group of smaller agencies across the country; Rapp Collins Worldwide in New York, in partnership with Martin/Williams Advertising in Minneapolis, which, like BBDO, are owned by the Omnicom Group; and Young & Rubicam Advertising in New York. Rapp Collins had also worked on the account with BBDO.
